vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
λεγεών, ῶνος, ἡ,
= Latin legio, [NT+1st c.AD+]:—frequently written λεγιών, [Refs]: —hence λεγιονάριος, ὁ, [Refs]
vocabInfos.shortDef: legion, technically an army unit of 6,000 with 6,000 support troops. Twice in the NT it is the proper name of a collective of demons (<ref='Mrk.5.9'>Mk 5:9</ref>; <ref='Luk.8.30'>Lk 8:30</ref>)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ legion, technically an army unit of 6,000 with 6,000 support troops. Twice in the NT it is the proper name of a collective of demons (Mk 5:9; Lk 8:30)
also spelled λεγεών, a Roman legion; in NT used indefinitely for a great number, Mt. 26:53; Mk. 5:9, 15, Lk. 8:30*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: legión (En el ejército romano, una legión se componía de entre 5000-6000 soldados; figurativo para una cifra más grande)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
軍團, 一隊軍人, 軍人的編制在不同時期有所差別,
在奧古斯都時約有6826人(亦即6100步兵和726騎兵) (太26:53;可5:9,15;路8:30)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
军团, 一队军人, 军人的编制在不同时期有所差别,
在奥古斯都时约有6826人(亦即6100步兵和726骑兵) (太26:53;可5:9, 15;路8:30)
